meanings.def: to come out of your mother’s body at the beginning of your life
examples: I was born in 1976.
He was born in a small village in northern Spain.
She was born on 7 February 1874.
The baby was born by Caesarean section on Friday.
born into something She was born into a very musical family.
These children were born into poverty.
born of/to somebody He was born of/to German parents.
born with something She was born with a rare heart condition.
She was born with a weak heart.
+ adj. Her brother was born blind (= was blind when he was born).
+ noun John Wayne was born Marion Michael Morrison (= that was his name at birth).
She was born into a wealthy family.
Their child was born with a serious medical problem.
babies who are born to very young mothers
to be born of noble parents
the city where the protest movement was born
born (out) of something She acted with a courage born (out) of desperation.

meanings.def: born in the order, way, place, etc. mentioned
examples: firstborn
nobly born
French-born
The part is played by an American-born actress.

meanings.def: to behave or do things in a particular manner because it is part of your character
examples: It's not his fault he's so pompous—he was born that way.

meanings.def: to have something as your destiny (= what is certain to happen to you) from birth
examples: He was born to be a great composer.

meanings.def: born and having grown up in a particular place with a particular background and education
examples: He was born and bred in Boston.
I'm a Londoner, born and bred.
I was born and bred in Texas.

meanings.def: used when you are very surprised at something you have never heard or seen before
examples: I've never heard such nonsense in all my born days.

meanings.def: used to say that you are not stupid enough to believe what somebody is telling you
examples: Oh yeah? I wasn't born yesterday, you know.

meanings.def: to have an easy life without realizing how easy it is
examples: You people without kids don't know you're born.

meanings.def: used to say that somebody is very stupid
as if something is natural for you and you have done it many times in the past
examples: She adapted to life on the estate as if to the manner born.

idioms.def: to behave or do things in a particular manner because it is part of your character
examples: It's not his fault he's so pompous—he was born that way.

idioms.def: to have something as your destiny (= what is certain to happen to you) from birth
examples: He was born to be a great composer.

idioms.def: born and having grown up in a particular place with a particular background and education
examples: He was born and bred in Boston.
I'm a Londoner, born and bred.
I was born and bred in Texas.

idioms.idiom: born with a silver spoon in your mouth

idioms.def: used when you are very surprised at something you have never heard or seen before
examples: I've never heard such nonsense in all my born days.

idioms.def: used to say that you are not stupid enough to believe what somebody is telling you
examples: Oh yeah? I wasn't born yesterday, you know.

idioms.def: to have an easy life without realizing how easy it is
examples: You people without kids don't know you're born.

idioms.def: used to say that somebody is very stupid
as if something is natural for you and you have done it many times in the past
examples: She adapted to life on the estate as if to the manner born.

meanings.def: having a natural ability or skill for a particular activity or job
examples: a born athlete/writer/leader
a born loser (= a person who always loses or is unsuccessful)
